result.execSummary:
The defendant Joanne Lynn Cramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joanne Lynn Cramer in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Robin K Zbikowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same. Upon pl to both counts of CDTP, the State recommends a fine
P-NC to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Restitution has been sent via check drawn on Mr. Cafferty's trust account, to the victim today.

BTC: guilty as above. Restitution has been made to the victim prior to the agreement and the plea.
           $1000.00 + cc on Ct 1
           $1,000.00 on Ct 2 but cost are waived with the exception of VW fees. 60 dtp for both counts. FTP = 1 day RCJ for every $50 owed.
